question: SATAT initiative, which was seen in the news recently, is associated with which Union Ministry?
option1: Ministry of Social Justice and Empowerment
option2: Ministry of Petroleum and Natural Gas
option3: Ministry of New and Renewal Energy
answer: Ministry of Petroleum and Natural Gas
explanation:
A MoU was signed between the Ministry of Petroleum and Natural Gas and leading oil & gas marketing companies and technology providers to set up Compressed Bio-Gas (CBG) plants across India.
The CBG plants are to be set up under the Sustainable Alternative Towards Affordable Transportation (SATAT) initiative. The Union Government has set a target to set up 5000 CBG plants by 2023-24 with production target of 15 MMT.
